intro: Cynanchum proctorianum, commonly known as Proctor's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces a milky sap, which is a common feature in the genus Cynanchum. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
